elements.name: Challenge-response auth
elements.summary: Auth must use explicit challenge-response signatures to prevent replay and ambiguous signing.

elements.name: No browser secrets
elements.summary: No long-lived secrets (API keys, private keys) may be persisted client-side in the browser.

elements.name: Backpressure
elements.summary: Protect systems under load.

elements.name: Closed keys, open extensions
elements.summary: Closed schema keys; x_* extension namespace.

elements.name: Separation of duties
elements.summary: Critical actions require independent roles (e.g., author vs approver).

elements.name: Composability
elements.summary: Small correct parts compose into large systems.

elements.name: Contracts over conventions
elements.summary: Machine-checkable over "everyone knows".

elements.name: Cost awareness
elements.summary: Expose ongoing costs and commitments.

elements.name: Default safe
elements.summary: Safe defaults; opt-in risk.

elements.name: Determinism
elements.summary: Same input -> same output, with receipts.

elements.name: Idempotent messages
elements.summary: Messages and operations are designed to be safely replayed under retries/duplication.

elements.name: Safety over liveness
elements.summary: Prefer correctness/safety over availability when forced by failure modes.

elements.name: Make it explicit
elements.summary: Explicit contracts beat implicit magic.

elements.name: Forkability
elements.summary: Let communities fork overlays without breaking spine.

elements.name: Graceful degradation
elements.summary: Fail safely with useful UX.

elements.name: Human-readable failures
elements.summary: Gates fail with precise fix instructions.

elements.name: Idempotence
elements.summary: Safe retries via idempotent operations.

elements.name: Isolation first
elements.summary: Isolation and containment come before convenience.

elements.name: Least privilege
elements.summary: Isolation boundaries follow least-privilege to minimize blast radius of faults and compromise.

elements.name: Least privilege runtime
elements.summary: Runtime privileges are minimized to reduce blast radius.

elements.name: Least privilege
elements.summary: Default-deny; grant minimal rights.

elements.name: Backward compatibility
elements.summary: Boundary changes preserve compatibility within a declared window.

elements.name: Failure isolation
elements.summary: Boundary failures are isolated; upstream/downstream degradation is explicit and controlled.

elements.name: Monotonic evidence
elements.summary: Evidence should accumulate, not disappear.

elements.name: No blob magnets
elements.summary: Avoid giant free-text fields as control planes.

elements.name: Non-custodial by default
elements.summary: User holds keys; kits are opt-in.

elements.name: Observability
elements.summary: Measure what matters (golden signals).

elements.name: Minimal disclosure
elements.summary: Only disclose what is necessary for the verifier to accept a claim; avoid oversharing by default.

elements.name: Progressive disclosure
elements.summary: Show complexity only when needed.

elements.name: Safety case integrity
elements.summary: Safety/compliance evidence must be complete, traceable, and resistant to tampering.

elements.name: Separation of duties
elements.summary: Critical actions require distinct roles to reduce fraud/accident risk.

elements.name: Reversible by default
elements.summary: Prefer reversible changes; gate irreversible.

elements.name: Bounded time
elements.summary: Time budgets are first-class invariants; missing deadlines is a correctness failure.

elements.name: Deadline safety first
elements.summary: Safety of deadlines takes precedence over throughput or convenience.

elements.name: Safety over features
elements.summary: Prefer safety and bounded behavior over feature richness under time constraints.

elements.name: Separation of concerns
elements.summary: Different things change for different reasons.

elements.name: Determinism over variance
elements.summary: Prefer deterministic behavior for replay/debuggability.

elements.name: Determinism over vibes
elements.summary: Deterministic behavior is prioritized over non-replayable emergent variation in critical simulation paths.

elements.name: State must be reproducible
elements.summary: Simulation state evolution must be reproducible from declared inputs.

elements.name: Single source of truth
elements.summary: One canonical record; normalize on write.

elements.name: Small basis set
elements.summary: Correctness first; breadth via bonding.

elements.name: State completeness
elements.summary: Every async path has pending/success/fail UX.

elements.name: User agency
elements.summary: Users can understand and undo where possible.
